SEARCH
Package sync

Class Server

java.lang.Object
sync.Server
public class Server extends Object
Class for server side of the synchronization, it contains for receiving data from the server and for sending data to the server. At first we want the server to receive data from the client only, but because we need the synchronization to work both ways, we also need to send data to the client.

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server()

  • Method Details

    • startServer

      public void startServer(Integer port) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      This method starts the server so it can receive data from the client, and calls the methods for the synchronization. It contains a thread that receives data from client, and a thread that checks if files have been added or deleted, and sends data if needed
      Parameters:
      port - the port of the server
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • receiveFiles

      public void receiveFiles(String data) throws IOException
      This method contains the logic to receive data from the server. It deserializes the data and creates the files and folders. We deserialize the string using the separator "||", and we create the files and folders. We receive in order the type of the file (file or folder), the path of the file, and the content of the file if it's a file.
      Parameters:
      data - the data to deserialize
      Throws:
      IOException

    • stopServer

      public void stopServer() throws IOException
      This method is used to stop the server, useful for the GUI
      Throws:
      IOException

    • check

      public int check(File directory)
      This method is used to check the number of files and folders in the destination folder, it is used to know if files have been added or deleted
      Parameters:
      directory - the directory to check
      Returns:
      the number of files and folders in the directory

    • delete

      public void delete(File file)
      This method is used to delete files and folders that are not in the list of files sent by the server
      Parameters:
      file - the file to delete

    • deleteFolder

      public void deleteFolder(File folder)
      This method is used to delete a folder and all its content
      Parameters:
      folder - the folder to delete

    • send

      public void send(File file)
      This method contains the logic to send data to the server. It serializes the files and sends them to the server, we turn the bytes of data into a base64 string, and send it to the server
      Parameters:
      file - the file to send to the server
